title: Prime Minister of France - Wikipedia
snippet: The current prime minister of France is Sébastien Lecornu who was appointed on 9 September 2025 and resigned on 6 October 2025, but was re-appointed on 10 October.

title: Opinion | France Needs a New France - The New York Times
snippet: First, the government was toppled by an irate Parliament. Then, in a panic, President Emmanuel Macron tapped a protégé, Sébastien Lecornu, to be prime minister; he resigned less than a month later.

title: Emmanuel Macron - Wikipedia
snippet: After Bayrou was himself brought down by a confidence vote in September 2025, Macron appointed Sébastien Lecornu, Minister of the Armed Forces, as Prime Minister. Lecornu resigned less than a month later following political backlash over the composition of his government, but was reappointed ...

title: French Government Collapses: What Happens Next — and Who Will Be the Next PM? | IBTimes UK
snippet: François Bayrou's centrist government unravelled on 8 September 2025, when the National Assembly rejected his confidence motion by 364 votes to 194, forcing his resignation the following day.

title: Macron names ally Sébastien Lecornu as new French PM
snippet: President Emmanuel Macron has named close ally Sébastien Lecornu as the new French prime minister, 24 hours after a vote of confidence ousted François Bayrou as head of government.
